questions.question_text:
A developer is integrating with a legacy on-premise SQL database.
What should the developer use to ensure the data being integrated is matched to the right records in Salesforce?

discussion.content: It should be External Id field

D
An External ID field is a custom field in Salesforce that is marked as an external identifier. It can be used to uniquely identify records when performing data integration between Salesforce and external systems, including on-premise SQL databases. By specifying an External ID field in your integration process, you can ensure that data from the external system is correctly matched and associated with the corresponding records in Salesforce based on the values in the External ID field.

choices.A: Add an onerror event handler to the tag.
choices.C: Use an AuraHandledException in a try/catch block.
choices.D: Use ProcessBuilder to catch the error.
choices.B: Add an error-view component to the markup.

discussion.content: C, AuraHandled Exception is used to track the error when Apex is interacting with Lightning Component

Selected Answer: C
C. is correct due to internal server error vs client side error.

A. might seem like a reasonable approach, but it does not directly address the issue of internal server errors caused by Apex exceptions. An "internal server error" originates from the server-side Apex controller, not the client-side JavaScript code. Since the error happens in Apex, the best way to provide a meaningful error message is inside Apex itselfâ€”which is exactly what AuraHandledException does.
